title: Functions, institutions under Ministries gazetted
byline: A Gazette  Extraordinary has been published detailing the subjects, functions, Departments, Statutory Institutions and Public Corporations under new Ministries.

title: Upcountry railway line disrupted
byline: The upcountry railway line has been disrupted between Badulla and Bandarawela due to landslides and falling rocks, the Railways Department said.

title: Amid heavy rains A/L candidates advised to use nearest exam centres
byline: The Department of Examinations today advised Advanced Level (A/L) candidates to report to the nearest examination centres if they are unable to reach their assigned centres due to disasters caused by the heavy rains.

title: Possible floods in Mahaweli River and Heda Oya basin today
byline: Due to heavy rainfall received last night, there is a possibility of flooding in low-lying areas around the Mahaweli River and Heda Oya basins, the Irrigation Department said.

title: Over 50,000 people affected due to natural disasters
byline: A total of 55,416 persons from 15,670 families have been affected across ten districts due to natural disasters such as flash floods, strong winds and falling trees, the Disaster Management Centre (DMC) reported.

title: Depression in Southwest Bay of Bengal to intensify, near east coast
byline: The depression over the southwest Bay of Bengal was located approximately 410 km southeast of Trincomalee last night.

title: Several roads in Badulla obstructed due to heavy rains
byline: The Disaster Management Centre (DMC) announced today that several roads in the Badulla and Passara areas are obstructed due to heavy rainfall till last night.

title: CEB union confident government will fulfill bonus demands: Ranjan Jayalal
byline: As the only CEB trade union representing the government, they are confident that the government will fulfill their demands, including providing the bonus, said Ceylon Electricity Employees’ Union General Secretary, Ranjan Jayalal.

title: Will commit suicide if not appointed through national list: Former SJB MP
byline: Former Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) MP Thushara Indunil Amarasena said he will commit suicide if he is not appointed to Parliament through the national list.

title: No Viyathmaga members backing NPP
byline: While condemning claims that Viyathmaga members are backing the National People’s Power (NPP) government, Cabinet Spokesman and Media Minister Nalinda Jayathissa today assured that no one from Viyathmaga has been appointed as Ministers or Ministry Secretaries.

title: Cabinet approves purchase of four diesel shipments
byline: The Cabinet has approved the purchase of four shipments of diesel (0.05%, M.S) for six months, from December 15, 2024, to June 14, 2025.

title: Previous govt accused of importing substandard medicines, skipping future orders
byline: Cabinet Spokesman and Media Minister Nalinda Jayathissa claimed that the previous government was not only responsible for importing substandard medicines but also failed to place medicine orders for the upcoming year.

title: Imran Khan supporters breach lockdown in Islamabad, several people killed
byline: Supporters seeking the release of imprisoned Pakistani former premier Imran Khan broke through a ring of shipping containers locking down the capital Islamabad, while at least six people have died in protest-related violence.

title: Arrest warrant issued on newly elected Jaffna MP
byline: The Colombo Magistrate’s Court today issued a warrant for the arrest of newly elected Jaffna District Parliamentarian Dr Ramanathan Archchuna for failing to appear before the court in connection with a traffic accident that occurred in 2021.

title: Government not involved in Veyangoda treasure excavation: Minister
byline: The government was not involvement in the excavations for treasure near Wandurawa Rajamaha Vihara in Veyangoda, Cabinet spokesman Minister Nalinda Jayatissa said today.

title: Govt. taking Adani allegations seriously; No decision yet on projects: Minister
byline: In the wake of bribery allegations against Indian billionaire Gautam Adani in the US, Cabinet Spokesman and Minister Nalinda Jayathissa said that the Sri Lankan government was taking the matter seriously.

title: Cabinet not formed based on race, religion or caste: Minister
byline: In response to concerns raised on the lack of Muslim representatives in the recent Cabinet appointments, Cabinet spokesman and Media Minister Nalinda Jayathissa stated that the Cabinet was not formed based on race, religion or caste.

title: President to visit China after Indian visit
byline: China has invited President Anura Kumara Dissanayake for an official visit, Cabinet spokesman Minister Nalinda Jayatissa said today.

title: Budget proposals for 2025 to be presented on January 9
byline: Cabinet spokesman and Minister Dr. Nalinda Jayathissa said the 2025 Budget proposals will be presented to Parliament on January 9, 2025.
